Definition: Of a color that is like that of blood or a ruby.
Example: He made a red paper heart for Valentine's Day.
Synonyms: scarlet, vermilion, ruby, ruby-red, ruby-coloured, cherry, cherry-red

Definition: Perceive with the eyes; discern visually.
Example: In the distance she could see the blue ocean.
Synonyms: discern, perceive, glimpse, catch a glimpse of, get a glimpse of, spot, notice

Definition: Enjoyment, amusement, or lighthearted pleasure.
Example: The children were having fun in the play area.
Synonyms: pleasure, entertainment, enjoyment, amusement, excitement, gratification

Definition: A loud, unpleasant, and prolonged noise.
Example: The fans made an awful din.
Synonyms: uproar, racket, loud noise, confused noise, commotion, cacophony, babel

Definition: To drop suddenly.
Example: The boy was careful not to fall from the tree.
Synonyms: drop, drop down, plummet, descend, come down, go down, plunge

Definition: To go quickly by moving the legs.
Example: The dog liked to run across the field.
Synonyms: sprint, race, dart, rush, dash, hasten, hurry

Definition: Say something in order to obtain an answer or some information.
Example: Students should ask many questions.
Synonyms: enquire, enquire of, query, want to know, question, put a question to, interrogate

Definition: A boy or young man (often as a form of address).
Example: Come in, lad, and shut the door.
Synonyms: boy, schoolboy, youth, youngster, juvenile, stripling, young fellow

Definition: Of the most excellent, effective, or desirable type or quality.
Example: She is the best pitcher in the league.
Synonyms: finest, greatest, top, foremost, leading, pre-eminent, premier

Definition: Give (someone) money that is due for work done, goods received, or a debt incurred.
Example: He needs to pay the locals to pick his coffee beans.
Synonyms: reward, reimburse, recompense, give payment to, settle up with, remunerate, tip

Definition: A garden or park where wild animals are kept so the public can see them.
Example: The children love to visit the elephants at the zoo.
Synonyms: menagerie, captivity, reservation, sanctuary, safari park

Definition: A naturally raised area of land, not as high or craggy as a mountain.
Example: He climbed the hill for a better view.
Synonyms: high ground, rising ground, prominence, eminence, elevation, rise, hillock

Definition: The invisible gaseous substance surrounding the earth, a mixture mainly of oxygen and nitrogen.
Example: The doctor told me to get some fresh air.
Synonyms: breeze, wind, draft, stratosphere

Definition: Have or retain possession of.
Example: The prince would keep the best for himself.
Synonyms: have, manage, preserve, retain, save, accumulate

Definition: A limbless cold-blooded vertebrate animal with gills and fins and living wholly in water.
Example: The sea is thick with fish.
Synonyms: N/A

Definition: Being a single person or thing and no more.
Example: There's only room for one person.
Synonyms: single, solitary, sole, lone

Definition: Organs used to get oxygen from water.
Example: Fish can pump water across their gills with their head muscles.
Synonyms: openings, funnels, orifices, cavities

Definition: A way or track laid down for walking or made by continual treading.
Example: He walked the path to the school.
Synonyms: footpath, pathway, footway, pavement, track, jogging track, trail

Definition: Moisture condensed from the atmosphere that falls visibly in separate drops.
Example: The rain had not stopped for days.
Synonyms: rainfall, precipitation, raindrops, rainwater, wet weather

Definition: Noisily release air from the stomach through the mouth; belch.
Example: The baby will often burp and then smile.
Synonyms: belch, bring up wind

Definition: A portable shelter made of canvas or other material that is stretched across poles.
Example: He decided to pitch his tent next to the river.
Synonyms: shelter, canvas, canopy, tarpaulin, covering

Definition: Affected by physical or mental illness.
Example: They are nursing very sick children.
Synonyms: ill, unwell, poorly, ailing, indisposed, laid up

Definition: A system of words, figures, or other symbols substituted for others, esp. for secrecy.
Example: The spies used a secret code to send messages.
Synonyms: cipher, secret language, secret writing, set of symbols, key, hieroglyphics

Definition: A complex pattern of paths that branch out and connect in a confusing way.
Example: Running through a corn maze is a fun fall activity.
Synonyms: tangle, twist, labyrinth, winding, puzzle

Definition: Networks of crisscrossing threads that are made by spiders to catch prey.
Example: The spider spun webs to catch flies.
Synonyms: mesh, netting, net, lattice

Definition: A small vessel propelled on water by oars, sails, or an engine.
Example: A fishing boat drifted in the lake.
Synonyms: vessel, craft, watercraft, ship

Definition: The day of the month or year as specified by a number.
Example: What's the date today?
Synonyms: day, day of the month, occasion, year, anniversary, time

Definition: To cut or shorten (something) to make it neater or more regular.
Example: Trim the grass using a sharp mower.
Synonyms: cut, barber, crop, bob, shorten, clip, snip

Definition: The usually grassy land surrounding a house.
Example: He planted a new tree in his yard.
Synonyms: backyard, courtyard, garden, lawn, enclosure

Definition: A period of seven days.
Example: The course lasts for one week.
Synonyms: period of time, seven days

Definition: A physical or mental competition that has rules and which players try to win.
Example: Did you win your basketball game?
Synonyms: match, contest, tournament, meeting, sports meeting, meet, event

Definition: A feeling of expectation and desire for a certain thing to happen.
Example: He looked through her belongings in the hope of coming across some information.
Synonyms: aspiration, desire, wish, expectation, ambition, aim, plan

Definition: A large body of water surrounded by land.
Example: The boys were swimming in the lake.
Synonyms: pond, pool, tarn, reservoir, lagoon, waterhole, inland sea

Definition: Gave up (something) to someone else in exchange for money or something else of value.
Example: They sold the car to buy a boat.

Definition: The male ruler of an independent state, especially one who inherits the position by right of birth.
Example: The king ruled the entire country.
Synonyms: ruler, sovereign, monarch, supreme ruler, crowned head, majesty, crown

Definition: A very short time ago : very recently.
Example: I just won the lottery!
Synonyms: right now, recently, presently, at this moment

Definition: Being any number that can be exactly divided by two.
Example: She can count by both even and odd numbers.
Synonyms: Divisible by two, not odd

Definition: Support and move (someone or something) from one place to another.
Example: Medics sometimes carry a wounded person on a stretcher.
Synonyms: convey, transfer, move, take, bring, bear, shift

Definition: A short, sharp cry, especially of pain or alarm.
Example: She uttered a yelp as she bumped into a table.
Synonyms: squeal, squawk, screech, shriek, scream, howl, yowl

Definition: The upper and lower parts of the mouth containing teeth that open and close.
Example: The shark's jaws snapped closed.
Synonyms: jawbones, mandibles

Definition: To object to : dislike.
Example: He didn't mind the breeze on a hot day.
Synonyms: dislike, resent, object, complain, disapprove

Definition: A white crystal-like substance that is used especially to season or preserve food.
Example: Just a pinch of salt can improve a meal.
Synonyms: sodium chloride, brine, spice, flavoring, seasoning

Definition: A large or important place where a lot of people live.
Example: The city bustled with people and activity.
Synonyms: town, municipality, metropolis, megalopolis

Definition: Oval, hard-shelled objects from which young birds are born.
Example: The eggs were about to hatch.
Synonyms: seeds, buds, ova

Definition: To or at a distance from a particular place, person, or thing.
Example: He hiked away from the city.
Synonyms: aside, off, to one side

Definition: A small area of still water, either natural or man-made for swimming.
Example: They swam in the pool to cool off.
Synonyms: puddle, pond, basin, tank

Definition: A meal eaten in the middle of the day.
Example: She enjoyed her vegetarian lunch.
Synonyms: midday meal, luncheon

Definition: Feeling or showing pleasure or contentment.
Example: She came in looking happy and excited.
Synonyms: contented, content, cheerful, cheery, merry, joyful, jovial

Definition: A type of large, flat, green or whitish bean that can be eaten.
Example: Lima beans are a nutritious food.
Synonyms: N/A

Definition: A smooth-skinned juicy berry usually green or red in color.

Synonyms: berries, vine fruits, wine crop

Definition: Having a really good taste or flavor.
Example: She ate three yummy pumpkin cakes.
Synonyms: tasty, appetizing, pleasant-tasting

Definition: Being reserved or having or showing nervousness or timidity in the company of other people.
Example: I was pretty shy at school.
Synonyms: bashful, diffident, timid, sheepish, reserved, reticent, introverted

Definition: A substance, such as mud or dust, that soils someone or something.
Example: His face was covered in dirt.
Synonyms: grime, dust, soot, smut

Definition: Turn or cause to turn or whirl around quickly.
Example: The girl watched the top spin on the table.
Synonyms: revolve, rotate, turn, turn round, go round, whirl, gyrate

Definition: Insects or other similar creeping or crawling animals.

Synonyms: insects, fleas, mites, midges

Definition: A long, loose outer garment.
Example: He spent the weekend lounging in his robe.
Synonyms: cloak, wrap, mantle, cape, kaftan

Definition: Protected from or not exposed to danger or risk; not likely to be harmed or lost.
Example: The eggs are hidden in the damp sand, safe from marine predators.
Synonyms: protected from danger, protected from harm, shielded, sheltered, guarded, defended, secure

Definition: In an unsatisfactory, inadequate, or unsuccessful way.
Example: The war was going badly.
Synonyms: poorly, incompetently, ineptly, inexpertly, inefficiently, imperfectly, deficiently

Definition: A climbing or trailing woody-stemmed plant of the grape family.
Example: He found tasty blackberries growing on the vine.
Synonyms: climbing plant, trailing plant, creeper

Definition: (Of a cat) make a low continuous vibratory sound expressing contentment.
Example: The cat's purr comforted them.

Definition: (Of an action, activity, or piece of work) having been completed or ended.
Example: After two hours, the students were finally done with the test.
Synonyms: completed, concluded, consummated, finalized, terminated, over and done with, over

Definition: Easily broken, cracked or snapped.
Example: She always made a salad with crisp lettuce.
Synonyms: brittle, crunchy, fresh

Definition: The front part of your head that has your chin, mouth, nose, cheeks and eyes.
Example: It was as obvious as the nose on his face.
Synonyms: aspect, look, mask, appearance, countenance, front of something

Definition: (Of a time or season) coming immediately after the time of writing or speaking.

Definition: Inconsiderate and harsh to others.
Example: You were terribly mean to her.
Synonyms: nasty, hostile, rude, vile, callous, unkind, cruel

Definition: Heavy with moisture or water : soaked.

Synonyms: soft and wet, mushy, squashy, pulpy, pappy, slushy, sloppy

Definition: A short, sharp sound as of a switch or of two hard objects coming into contact.

Definition: A particular level of rank, quality, proficiency, intensity, or value.

Definition: The parts of an animal's body that it moves to fly.

Definition: During the period of time preceding (a particular event, date, or time).

Definition: Involuntarily open one's mouth wide and inhale deeply due to tiredness or boredom.

Definition: Large roots of a garden plant that are often used as vegetables.

Definition: A slender woody shoot growing from a branch or stem of a tree or shrub.
Example: She used a twig to rescue the spider from the stream.

Definition: A cat whose fur is mottled or streaked with dark stripes.
Example: They adopted the wild tabby.

Definition: A structure of bars or wires in which birds or other animals are confined.
Example: She kept a canary in a cage.

Definition: The soft, wavy or curly hair of some animals (such as sheep) often used to make cloth.
Example: The wool jacket was warm, but a bit uncomfortable.

Definition: A type of product manufactured by a particular company under a particular name.
Example: He tried a new brand of detergent.
Synonyms: make, line, label, marque

Definition: A thin sheet of fibers used in many ways, including as a surface for writing.
Example: A printer holds many sheets of paper.
Synonyms: sheet, pad, note, poster, stationery

Definition: Move or act with great haste.

Synonyms: be quick, hurry up, move quickly, go fast, hasten, make haste, speed

Definition: In the time following (an event or another period of time).

Definition: Trash, such as paper, cans, and bottles, that is left lying in an open or public place.

Definition: Having or keeping (something) in your hands or arms.

Definition: A public road in a city or town, typically with houses and buildings on one or both sides.

Definition: A room or space directly under the roof of a house or other building.

Definition: Light and soft or airy.

Synonyms: fleecy, woolly, fuzzy, shaggy, hairy, feathery, downy

Definition: An anxious awareness of danger.

Definition: The characteristic grunting sound of a pig.

Definition: A large room that is used as the entrance area to a building.

Definition: Quick to notice any unusual and potentially dangerous or difficult circumstances; vigilant.

Definition: To walk quietly or cautiously on only the front ends of your feet.

Definition: Bags usually made of cloth and filled with soft material used to support the head when lying down.

Definition: To change, adjust or improve often experimentally.

Definition: A seed-eating songbird that typically has a stout bill and colorful plumage.
Example: A colorful finch could be seen in our front tree each morning.

Definition: Asphalt, or other black material used for surfacing roads.

Definition: A person or thing that heats, in particular a device for warming the air or water.

Definition: The period of time between midnight and noon, especially from sunrise to noon.

Definition: Something given voluntarily without payment in return; a gift.

Definition: A time between classes during the school day that is used for rest or play.

Definition: A thin usually round layer of bread dough covered in toppings and baked.

Example: The ending of the war was celebrated.

Definition: A building for human habitation, especially one that is lived in by a family or small group of people.

Definition: In a kind manner.

Definition: Make or become less tense or anxious.

Definition: Meat from the sides of a pig that has been salted and smoked.

Definition: A radio device or system for locating an object.

Definition: The earth or a round ball that has a map of the earth drawn on it.

Definition: A large ox with long wavy hair that is used for its milk and meat and to carry heavy loads.

Definition: Objects used to indicate a position, place, or route.

Definition: Bread that is shaped and baked in one piece and usually sliced before being eaten.

Definition: (Of a smooth surface) reflecting light, typically from being very clean or polished.

Definition: A club or party at which people dance to pop music.

Definition: A tree with gray bark, sectioned leaves, hard wood and sap used to make syrup.

Definition: To secure something against opening by using a device for holding it closed.

Definition: The ability to see something or to be seen from a particular place.

Definition: A tailless amphibian with a short stout body and short legs, typically having dry warty skin.

Definition: A social unit consisting of one or more adults together with the children they care for.

Definition: A category of people or things having common characteristics.

Definition: A dessert with a creamy consistency.

Definition: Periods of time lasting 60 minutes.

Definition: A large area covered chiefly with trees and undergrowth.

Definition: A chiefly nocturnal insect related to the butterflies.
Example: The moths were drawn to the light of the lantern.

Definition: The sound produced by a sudden rush of air or liquid.

Definition: A material thing that can be seen and touched.

Definition: An amount of teaching given at one time; a period of learning or teaching.

Definition: Plants that have woody stems and don't grow very tall.

Definition: Twisted together untidily; matted.

Definition: A long or arduous search for something.

Definition: Using or expressing dry, especially mocking, humor.

Definition: A small hard inflamed spot on the skin.

Definition: The anniversary of the day on which a person was born.

Definition: Having the status of a king or queen or a member of their family.

Definition: Not correct or true; incorrect.

Definition: A mythical animal typically represented as a horse with a single straight horn.

Definition: An imaginary mischievous sprite regarded as responsible for an unexplained problem.

Definition: At whatever time; on whatever occasion (emphasizing a lack of restriction).

Definition: Wasted or spoiled food and other refuse, as from a kitchen or household.

Definition: A device that makes a loud prolonged sound as a signal or warning.

Definition: The directions from which someone or something is viewed, considered or approached.

Definition: Look after and provide for oneself, without any help from others.

Definition: Waste material; refuse or litter.

Definition: Having a pleasing tune; melodious.
Example: That musical is full of tuneful songs.
Synonyms: melodious, melodic, musical, mellifluous, sweet-sounding, pleasant-sounding, dulcet

Definition: Having or revealing natural creative skill.

Definition: Being soft, yielding and damp.

Definition: Awkward in movement or in handling things.

Definition: Coarsely ground dried food products or grain.

Definition: Signals to a performer to begin a specific speech or action.

Definition: Talk with excessive pride and self-satisfaction about one's achievements, possessions, or abilities.
Example: She boasted about her many successes.

Definition: A solemn request for help or expression of thanks addressed to God or an object of worship.

Definition: Having or showing great effort or energy.
Example: He is a tireless campaigner.
Synonyms: vigorous, energetic, industrious, determined, resolute, enthusiastic, keen

Definition: A building or group of buildings where goods are manufactured or assembled chiefly by machine.
Example: Workers in the factory assembled cars.
Synonyms: works, plant, manufacturing complex, manufacturing facility, yard, mill, industrial unit

Definition: Take and use (something that belongs to someone else) with the intention of returning it.
Example: He had borrowed a car from one of his colleagues.
Synonyms: take, take for oneself, help oneself to, use as one's own, abscond with, carry off, appropriate

Definition: Thin strips cut off a surface.
Example: She brushed wood shavings from her knees.
Synonyms: debris, silt, slag, remains, leavings

Definition: A dog of a breed with a curly coat that is often ornamentally clipped.
Example: The poodles trotted with confidence.
Synonyms: dog, hound, canine

Definition: The force that attracts a body toward the center of the earth.
Example: Gravity keeps us from flying into space!
Synonyms: attraction, attracting force, downward force, pull, weight, heaviness

Definition: Deviating from what is normal or usual, typically in a way that is undesirable or worrying.
Example: The illness is recognizable from the patient's abnormal behavior.
Synonyms: unusual, uncommon, atypical, untypical, non-typical, unrepresentative, rare

Definition: Soft shoes with a rubber sole worn for sports or casual occasions.
Example: He was most comfortable in a pair of worn sneakers.
Synonyms: footwear, training shoes, running shoes, sports shoes, tennis shoes

Definition: Make a rapid succession of slight cracking noises.
Example: The crackle of the fire was comforting.
Synonyms: sizzle, frizzle, fizz, hiss, crack, snap, sputter

Definition: Fill (someone) with the urge or ability to do or feel something, especially something creative.
Example: Her writing would inspire an entire generation.
Synonyms: encourage, uplift, arouse, excite, motivate, hearten, instill

Definition: A double or multiple fold in a garment or other cloth item, held by stitching the top or side.
Example: She noticed the fine pleats in the dress pants.
Synonyms: folds, tucks, creases, gather, crimps

Definition: Shaking or trembling as a result of cold, illness, fear, or excitement.
Example: He felt cold and shivery.
Synonyms: trembling, trembly, quivering, quivery, shaking, shaky, shuddering

Definition: A meeting for giving information or instructions quickly.
Example: The daily press briefing brought everyone up to speed.
Synonyms: information, orientation, preparation, rundown

Definition: Get, acquire, or secure (something).
Example: A university provides the opportunity to obtain advanced degrees.
Synonyms: get, acquire, come by, secure, procure, come into possession of, pick up

Definition: Depict (someone or something) in a work of art or literature.
Example: The author wanted to portray a new type of hero.
Synonyms: paint, draw, draw a picture of, paint a picture of, picture, sketch, depict

Definition: Firmly press (something soft or yielding), typically with one's fingers.
Example: Mom would often squeeze his hand affectionately.
Synonyms: compress, press, crush, squash, pinch, nip, grasp

Definition: A continuous deep, resonant sound.
Example: The rumbling of wheels in the distance frightened them.
Synonyms: reverberation, resonance, throbbing, throb, vibrating, pulsation, pulsing

Definition: A movable plank used as a ramp to board or disembark from a ship or boat.
Example: The sailors put out the gangplank upon docking.
Synonyms: bridge, link, platform, overpass

Definition: Score or mark the surface of (something) with a sharp or pointed object.
Example: The car's paintwork was battered and scratched.
Synonyms: score, abrade, scrape, roughen, scuff, scuff up, lacerate

Definition: Pulled or twisted out of shape; contorted.
Example: The politician often distorted the facts.
Synonyms: twisted, warped, contorted, bent, buckled, deformed, malformed

Definition: Pasteboard or stiff paper.
Example: Fill the cardboard box with art supplies.
Synonyms: pasteboard, board, stiff paper

Definition: A meeting of people face to face, especially for consultation.
Example: He conducted interviews to find the best candidate.
Synonyms: meeting, discussion, conference, question and answer session, examination, evaluation, interrogation

Definition: Culpable of or responsible for a specified wrongdoing.
Example: He was found guilty of the crime.
Synonyms: culpable, to blame, blameworthy, blameable, at fault, in the wrong, responsible

Definition: Of, determined by, or resembling the moon.
Example: The lunar landscape was seen through the telescope.
Synonyms: bare, exposed, desolate, stark, arid, desert, denuded

Definition: A dessert or sweet sauce made with milk, eggs, and sugar.
Example: Eat all your vegetables and you'll earn the custard.
Synonyms: pudding, mousse

Definition: Utter a high-pitched piercing sound or words, often in terror, pain, or excitement.
Example: The boy at the horror movie let out a shriek.
Synonyms: scream, screech, squeal, squawk, roar, howl, bellow

Definition: A supernatural appearance : apparition.
Example: The building is haunted by the ghost of a monk.
Synonyms: spectre, phantom, wraith, spirit, soul, shadow, presence

Definition: An important assignment with which a person or group is charged.
Example: They went on a trade mission to Mexico.
Synonyms: assignment, commission, expedition, journey, trip, errand, undertaking

Definition: Appealing to or attracting someone, even if wrong or inadvisable.
Example: The company made her a tempting financial offer.
Synonyms: enticing, alluring, attractive, appealing, inviting, captivating, seductive

Definition: Having or showing impressive beauty or dignity.
Example: He watched majestic eagles soar along the Mississippi.
Synonyms: exalted, august, great, awesome, elevated, sublime, lofty

Definition: A means of solving a problem or dealing with a difficult situation.
Example: There is no easy solution to this math problem.
Synonyms: answer, resolution, explanation, result, fix

Definition: Sounds or gestures made to give warning or command.
Example: Smoke signals can be used to send distant messages.
Synonyms: gesture, sign, wave, gesticulation, cue, prompt, indicator

Definition: Completely remove or get rid of (something).
Example: The economist proposed a policy that would eliminate inflation.
Synonyms: remove, get rid of, abolish, put an end to, do away with, banish

Definition: All existing matter and space considered as a whole; the cosmos.
Example: There are so many mysteries in the universe.
Synonyms: cosmos, macrocosm, totality, whole world, creation, space, outer space

Definition: A large grasshopper with strong powers of flight that can swarm in large groups.
Example: The locusts ate the farmer's crops.
Synonyms: grasshoppers, cicadas

Definition: Advice or information aimed at resolving a problem or difficulty.
Example: He looked to his father for inspiration and guidance.
Synonyms: advice, counsel, direction, instruction, teaching, counselling, enlightenment

Definition: Devoted oneself to attentive reading.
Example: She pored over the law books for hours.
Synonyms: brooded, mused, examined, pondered, perused, contemplated

Definition: Material spread around or over a plant to enrich or insulate the soil.
Example: Give all fruit a mulch of manure or dead leaves.
Synonyms: fertilizer, compost, manure

Definition: A length of something wound or arranged in a spiral or sequence of rings.
Example: The spaghetti coiled around his fork as he twisted it.
Synonyms: braid, tendril, helix, ring, spiral

Definition: Cells, groups of cells, or organs producing a secretion.
Example: You have three pairs of salivary glands that secrete saliva.
Synonyms: N/A

Definition: An imaginary line about which a body rotates.
Example: The Earth revolves on its axis once every 24 hours.
Synonyms: centre line, axle, hinge, pivot, shaft

Definition: The pungent, fleshy root of a plant that is typically eaten raw.
Example: Heat the oil and add the radish, carrot and potato.
Synonyms: N/A

Definition: To tempt to do something, especially by offering some form of reward.
Example: The mermaid tried to lure the sailor into the ocean.
Synonyms: tempt, entice, attract, induce, coax, persuade

Definition: A heavy, flat iron plate that is heated and used for cooking food.
Example: Pancakes cooked on a griddle are my favorite.
Synonyms: broiler, skillet, frying pan

Definition: In a way that is not smooth and pleasant, but has quick and sudden movements.
Example: He looked like a frog as he moved jerkily through the water.
Synonyms: erratically, haphazardly, sporadically, unevenly

Definition: Fashionably elegant and sophisticated.
Example: The dress shoes were stylish, but not very comfortable.
Synonyms: fashionable, chic, classy, dapper, dressy, sleek, snazzy

Definition: Fell or rested on the knees.
Example: They knelt down and prayed.
Synonyms: genuflect, bow down, kowtow

Definition: Unravel or become worn at the edge, typically through constant rubbing.
Example: The rope joked that it was a frayed knot.
Synonyms: unravelling, unravelled, well worn, threadbare, tattered, ragged

Definition: Grew, sprung up or came forth as a shoot from a plant.
Example: The grass sprouted in the spring.
Synonyms: germinate, put forth shoots, bud

Definition: An object surviving from an earlier time, especially one of historical or sentimental interest.
Example: They found relics from the Mayan civilization.
Synonyms: artifact, historical object, ancient object, antiquity, antique, heirloom

Definition: Slight pain.
Example: The patient complained of discomfort in the left calf.
Synonyms: pain, aches and pains, soreness, tenderness, irritation, stiffness, malaise

Definition: An animal, as distinct from a human being.
Example: Night sounds of birds and other creatures kept him awake.
Synonyms: animal, beast, brute

Definition: A house, apartment, or other place of residence.
Example: The proposed dwelling is out of style with those nearby.
Synonyms: residence, habitation, home, house, accommodation, lodging

Definition: Poorly made and likely to collapse.
Example: We went carefully up the rickety stairs.
Synonyms: shaky, unsteady, unsound, unsafe, tottering, crumbling, decaying

Definition: Be present in large numbers, typically so as to cause damage or disease.
Example: The house is infested with cockroaches.
Synonyms: overrun, spread through, take over, overspread, swarm over, crawl over

Definition: The complete loss or absence of hope.
Example: He felt despair while stranded on the island.
Synonyms: hopelessness, desperation, distress, anguish, pain, unhappiness

Definition: A feeling of needing or wanting to drink something.
Example: They quenched their thirst with spring water.
Synonyms: yearning, dryness, longing, drought

Definition: Young or seeming young.
Example: All of us can stay youthful at heart.
Synonyms: spry, sprightly, vigorous, active

Definition: Having or showing sharp powers of judgment; astute.
Example: She was shrewd enough to guess the motive behind his gesture.
Synonyms: astute, sharp-witted, sharp, acute, intelligent, clever, alert

Definition: Fused or liquefied by heat : melted.
Example: The molten lava ran down the mountain.
Synonyms: liquefied, liquid, fluid, melted, flowing, soft

Definition: The main stem of a herbaceous plant.
Example: He chewed a stalk of grass.
Synonyms: stem, shoot, trunk, stock, cane

Definition: A distinctive, typically pleasant smell.
Example: She smelled the tantalizing aromas of baked cookies and bread.
Synonyms: smell, odour, fragrance, scent, perfume, whiff, redolence

Definition: A person who has defeated or surpassed all rivals in a competition, especially in sports.
Example: The tennis champion waved to the crowd.
Synonyms: winner, title-holder, gold medallist, unbeaten, undefeated

Definition: An assistant who sells goods in a retail store.
Example: The salesclerk helped us with our purchase.
Synonyms: seller, salesperson, dealer, trader, tradesman

Definition: A shapeless mass or blob of something, especially soft food.
Example: He added a great dollop of cream.
Synonyms: blob, glob, gobbet, lump, clump, ball, mound

Definition: Chivalrous, courteous, or honorable men.
Example: They behaved like perfect gentlemen.
Synonyms: men of honor, cavaliers, sirs

Definition: The condition of being imprisoned or confined.
Example: He was released after 235 days in captivity.
Synonyms: imprisonment, confinement, internment, incarceration, custody, detention, restraint

Definition: The action of talking long-windedly without making very much sense.
Example: Now stop your blathering and get back to work.
Synonyms: chattering, blabbering, blithering, chitchatting, gibbering, jabbering, prattling

Definition: The planet second in order from the sun.
Example: Have you seen Venus through a telescope?
Synonyms: N/A

Definition: Steady or resolute; not wavering.
Example: She fixed him with an unwavering stare.
Synonyms: steady, fixed, resolute, resolved, firm, steadfast, decided

Definition: People watching an exhibition (such as a sports event).
Example: Around fifteen thousand spectators came to watch the thrills and spills.
Synonyms: onlooker, watcher, looker-on, fly on the wall, viewer, observer, witness

Definition: The building of something, typically a large structure.
Example: There was a skyscraper under construction.
Synonyms: building, erection, putting up, setting up, raising, establishment, assembly

Definition: Use deception to deprive (someone) of money or possessions.
Example: The crook planned to swindle investors out of millions of dollars.
Synonyms: con, deceive, dupe, fleece, hoodwink, cheat, bamboozle

Definition: An indefinitely great number or amount.
Example: The infinity of space is difficult to comprehend.
Synonyms: endlessness, eternity, boundlessness, limitlessness, extensiveness

Definition: A reflective surface, typically of coated glass, that reflects a clear image.
Example: I'm starting with the man in the mirror.
Synonyms: looking glass, reflector, reflecting surface

Definition: To be like or similar to.
Example: Some people resemble their dogs.
Synonyms: parallel, simulate, mirror, approximate, echo, relate

Definition: A legally recognized subject or national of a state or commonwealth.
Example: She was proud to become a citizen.
Synonyms: inhabitant, civilian, national, resident, native

Definition: Make the sound of (a word or part of a word) in the correct or a particular way.
Example: Can you pronounce that word again?
Synonyms: say, enunciate, articulate, utter, express, voice, vocalize

Definition: Stretched or pulled tight; not slack.
Example: The fabric stays taut without adhesive.
Synonyms: tight, tightly stretched, stretched, rigid, stressed, not slack, not loose

Definition: The exclusive possession or control of the supply of or trade in a commodity or service.
Example: His likely motive was to protect his regional monopoly on furs.
Synonyms: cartel, trust, syndicate, consortium

Definition: A city in western central Italy, the capital of Tuscany.
Example: I would love to visit Florence one day.
Synonyms: N/A

Definition: A large, strong cat of southern Asia and Africa that is usually light orangish brown with black spots.
Example: The leopard hid in the tall grass looking to ambush its prey.
Synonyms: cheetah, panther

Definition: Very close friends : companions.
Example: He met up with his old college comrades.
Synonyms: companion, friend, buddy, colleague, compatriot, crony

Definition: Swung or turned on a part that pivots freely.
Example: She swiveled in her office chair.
Synonyms: pivot, revolve, rotate, whirl, hinge, pirouette

Definition: A large island of the Malay Archipelago southwest of the Philippines.
Example: Borneo is the third-largest island in the world and the largest in Asia.
Synonyms: N/A

Definition: A system of movable platforms that workers sit or stand on when working above the ground.
Example: The painter used the scaffolding to reach the ceiling.
Synonyms: frame, platform, boards

Definition: Withdraw from commercial or social relations with as a punishment or protest.
Example: We will boycott all banks which take part in the loans scheme.
Synonyms: spurn, snub, cold-shoulder, shun, avoid, abstain from, stay away from

Definition: A sudden strong and unreflective urge or desire to act.
Example: I had an almost irresistible impulse to giggle.
Synonyms: urge, instinct, drive, compulsion, need, itch

Definition: Attractive or appealing in appearance or character.
Example: The actor had a winsome smile.
Synonyms: appealing, engaging, charming, winning, attractive, pretty, sweet

Definition: To change back and forth between conditions, states, actions, etc.
Example: When lifting weights, alternate between your upper and lower body.
Synonyms: vary, waver, change, rotate, alter, intersperse, fluctuate

Definition: A cushioned footstool or low seat without back or arms.
Example: Recline and put your feet up on the ottoman.
Synonyms: footrest, hassock, stool

Definition: Provide (someone) with amusement or enjoyment.
Example: They liked to entertain guests in their home.
Synonyms: amuse, divert, distract, delight, please, charm, cheer

Definition: A waterproof jacket, typically with a hood, of a kind originally used in polar regions.
Example: An anorak is useful when visiting Alaska.
Synonyms: raincoat, cloak, frock, jacket, overcoat, windbreaker

Definition: Consisting of official pieces of written, printed, or other matter.
Example: His book is based on documentary sources.
Synonyms: recorded, documented, registered, written, chronicled, archived

Definition: The language peculiar to a particular trade, profession, or group.
Example: The document was full of legal jargon.
Synonyms: lingo, slang, idiom, argot, parlance, vernacular

Definition: Without charge; free.
Example: A monthly program was issued gratis.
Synonyms: free of charge, free, for nothing, at no cost, complimentary, freebie

Definition: Feelings of pity and sorrow for someone else's misfortune.
Example: They had great sympathy for the flood victims.
Synonyms: commiseration, pity, condolence, consolation, comfort, solace, support

Definition: A person or thing regarded as a perfect example of a particular quality.
Example: It would have taken a paragon of virtue not to feel jealous.
Synonyms: perfection, epitome, exemplar, essence, ideal

Definition: A chain or garland of flowers, leaves, or ribbons, hung in a curve as a decoration.
Example: The wedding hall was festooned with curvy strings of red roses.
Synonyms: garland, chain, lei, swathe, swag, wreath

Definition: The two small masses of tissue in the throat on each side of the root of the tongue.
Example: Some people need to have their tonsils removed.
Synonyms: N/A

Definition: An important or powerful person, especially in the motion picture or media industry.
Example: The Hollywood movie mogul practically owned the town.
Synonyms: magnate, tycoon, vip, notable, personage, baron

Definition: (In Japanese cooking) wheat pasta made in thick strips.
Example: Add the udon noodles and cook until they are heated through.
Synonyms: noodles, wheat pasta

Definition: Regularly or habitually; often.
Example: They go abroad frequently.
Synonyms: regularly, often, all the time, habitually, customarily, routinely

Definition: The quality of being pompous; self-importance.
Example: He had a reputation for arrogance and pomposity.
Synonyms: self-importance, imperiousness, grandiosity, affectation, stiffness

Definition: A long-distance running race, strictly one of 26 miles, 385 yards (42.195 km).
Example: The college athlete ran the marathon in record time.
Synonyms: prolonged, extended, stretched out, drawn out, lengthy

Definition: A strong verbal or written attack on someone or something.
Example: His polemic against his opponent went on for an hour.
Synonyms: diatribe, invective, denunciation, denouncement, rant, tirade, broadside

Definition: A kind of stew or side dish that is cooked slowly in an oven.
Example: Chicken casserole is her favorite.
Synonyms: goulash, hash, pottage, stew, pot pie

Definition: A precious silvery-white metal.
Example: She wore a platinum bracelet.
Synonyms: metal, silver, iron

Definition: Lacking interest or excitement; dull.
Example: Joe was tired of his mundane, humdrum job.
Synonyms: humdrum, dull, boring, tedious, monotonous, tiresome, wearisome

Definition: A long-haired domesticated South American mammal related to the llama, valued for its wool.
Example: They had an alpaca on their farm.
Synonyms: llama

Definition: A game played in which cues are used to strike balls into pockets.
Example: Shall we play billiards after dinner?
Synonyms: pool

Definition: A circular storm that forms over warm oceans. It brings heavy rains and strong winds when it hits land.
Example: The roads were packed with motorists fleeing the cyclone.
Synonyms: twister, windstorm, typhoon, hurricane

Definition: (Of a person or their behavior) not generous with money; miserly.
Example: After several years of Scrooge-like behavior, shoppers spent a bundle at Christmas.
Synonyms: cheapskate, miser, tightwad, moneygrubber

Definition: Polite, refined, or respectable, often in an affected or ostentatious way.
Example: Her genteel upbringing showed in her manners.
Synonyms: refined, respectable, polished, decorous, proper, polite, correct

Definition: Cooperate in a secret or unlawful way in order to deceive or gain an advantage over others.
Example: The judge warned the businesses not to collude.
Synonyms: conspire, connive, intrigue, plot, collaborate

Definition: A defender, protector, or keeper.
Example: The guardian watched over the precious jewels.
Synonyms: protector, defender, preserver, champion, custodian, warden

Definition: A pattern produced by arranging small colored pieces of hard material, such as stone, tile, or glass.
Example: The walls and vaults are decorated by marble and mosaic.
Synonyms: patchwork, montage, motley

Definition: A starchy substance in the form of hard white grains used in puddings.
Example: Did you enjoy your tapioca pudding?
Synonyms: custard, pudding, mousse

Definition: A conductor through which electricity enters or leaves an object.
Example: They hooked the electrode to the experiment.
Synonyms: terminal, wire

Definition: People employed in an organization such as a company or military service.
Example: Many of the personnel involved require training.
Synonyms: staff, employees, workforce, workers, labor force, manpower, human resources

Definition: Employing or involving modules as the basis of design or construction.
Example: Modular housing units are growing in popularity.
Synonyms: interchangeable, compatible, exchangeable, commutable

Definition: A soft boggy area of land that gives way underfoot.
Example: Torrential rain turned the building site into a quagmire.
Synonyms: swamp, morass, bog, marsh, mire

Definition: Say or pronounce clearly.
Example: The teacher would enunciate each word slowly.
Synonyms: pronounce, articulate

Definition: Exaggerated in speech or behavior.
Example: Just eat your peas and stop being so melodramatic.
Synonyms: theatrical, exaggerated, artificial, hammy

Definition: A class of resins used mainly in adhesives, coatings and castings.
Example: She fixed the vase with a strong epoxy.
Synonyms: adhesive, glue, fixative, gum, paste, bonding, binder

Definition: Laugh in a breathy, gleeful way; chuckle.
Example: The boy would chortle when watching his favorite show.
Synonyms: chuckle, laugh, giggle, titter, tee-hee, snigger

Definition: What You See Is What You Get. Text on a screen printing to paper exactly as seen.
Example: This program won't give you true WYSIWYG, but it does give a decent approximation.
Synonyms: exact, literal, accurate, precise

Definition: A circular tent of felt or skins on a collapsible framework, used by nomads in Mongolia, Siberia, and Turkey.
Example: They slept in a yurt while visiting Mongolia.
Synonyms: tent, shelter, tepee, wigwam

Definition: An elaborate and formal evening meal for many people, often followed by speeches.
Example: The emperor held a lavish banquet for his guests.
Synonyms: feast, reception, festivity

Definition: A long, steep slope, especially one at the edge of a plateau.
Example: They climbed the escarpment until they were well above the river.
Synonyms: mountain, hill, height, alp, cliff, ledge ridge

Definition: Having or showing zeal; ardently active, devoted, or diligent.
Example: The council was extremely zealous in the application of the regulations.
Synonyms: fervent, ardent, fervid, fiery, passionate, impassioned, devout

Definition: The furnishing and decoration of a room.
Example: Inside, the decor is elegant and traditional.
Synonyms: decoration, furnishing, furbishing, ornamentation

Definition: A surprising and previously unknown fact, especially one that is made known in a dramatic way.
Example: After the discussion, she had a revelation about her personal life.
Synonyms: disclosure, surprising fact, divulgence, declaration, utterance, announcement, report

Definition: Of uncertain, indefinite, or unclear character or meaning.
Example: Many patients suffer vague symptoms.
Synonyms: indistinct, indefinite, indeterminate, unclear

Definition: Cloud forming rounded masses heaped on each other above a flat base at fairly low altitude.
Example: The cumulus clouds are breaking up to give a lovely summer evening.
Synonyms: cloud, mist, vapor, fog

Definition: The process of piecing together separate sections of film to form a continuous whole.
Example: The boxer's training montage helped the audience believe his newfound success.
Synonyms: array, assortment, collection, medley
